paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the Thr60Ala mutation in the TTR gene, including penetrance data from family members.

patients.phenotype: TTR amyloidosis with polyneuropathy and cardiomyopathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Clinical signs of heart failure and polyneuropathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: We report an unusual case of a young Afro-Caribbean woman harboring a Thr60Ala mutation who presented with clinical signs of heart failure and polyneuropathy confirmed with genetic testing.
In the pedigree analysis, 13 family members were determined to also be affected with similar symptoms.

functional_data.summary: TTR mutations lead to misfolding and aggregation of the protein, causing amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in the family.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of TTR amyloidosis in the family is noted to be 100%.
key_quotes: This condition has an autosomal dominant inheritance pattern.
Pedigree analysis showed that of the 13 individuals in her family affected by the disease, 11 are now deceased, all before the age of 41 years.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR variant and penetrance were extracted.
